original_theorem:
If $\mathbf{X},$ $\mathbf{Y},$ and
$\mathbf{Z}$ are members of $\R^n$ and $a$ is a scalar, then
\begin{alist}
\item % (a)
 $|a\mathbf{X}|=|a|\,|\mathbf{X}|.$
\item % (b)
 $|\mathbf{X}|\ge0,$ with equality if and only if $\mathbf{X}=
\mathbf{0}.$
\item % (c)
 $|\mathbf{X}-\mathbf{Y}|\ge0,$ with equality if and only if
$\mathbf{X}=\mathbf{Y}.$
\item % (d)
$\mathbf{X}\cdot\mathbf{Y}=\mathbf{Y}\cdot\mathbf{X}.$
\item % (e)
 $\mathbf{X}\cdot (\mathbf{Y}+\mathbf{Z})=\mathbf{X}\cdot\mathbf{Y}+
\mathbf{X}\cdot\mathbf{Z}.$
\item % (f)
 $(c\mathbf{X})\cdot\mathbf{Y}=\mathbf{X}\cdot (c\mathbf{Y})=
c(\mathbf{X}\cdot\mathbf{Y}).$
\end{alist}
theorem_translation:
```lean4
theorem theorems_2_2_a_to_f {n : ℕ} (X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n)) (a c : ℝ) :
  ‖a • X‖ = |a| * ‖X‖
  ∧ ‖X‖ ≥ 0
  ∧ (‖X‖ = 0 ↔ X = 0)
  ∧ ‖X - Y‖ ≥ 0
  ∧ (‖X - Y‖ = 0 ↔ X = Y)
  ∧ X ⬝ Y = Y ⬝ X
  ∧ X ⬝ (Y + Z) = X ⬝ Y + X ⬝ Z
  ∧ (c • X) ⬝ Y = X ⬝ (c • Y)
  ∧ (c • X) ⬝ Y = c * (X ⬝ Y) := by
```

We assume:
• $\mathbf{X}$ is a member of $\R^n$ and $a$ is a scalar [tc_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
• The norm of a scaled vector is $|a\mathbf{X}|=|a|\,|\mathbf{X}|$ [l_bg_1].

set_option maxHeartbeats 0

theorem theorems_2_2_a_to_f {n : ℕ} (X Y Z : EuclideanSpace ℝ (Fin n)) (a c : ℝ) :
  ‖a • X‖ = |a| * ‖X‖
  ∧ ‖X‖ ≥ 0
  ∧ (‖X‖ = 0 ↔ X = 0)
  ∧ ‖X - Y‖ ≥ 0
  ∧ (‖X - Y‖ = 0 ↔ X = Y)
  ∧ X ⬝ Y = Y ⬝ X
  ∧ X ⬝ (Y + Z) = X ⬝ Y + X ⬝ Z
  ∧ (c • X) ⬝ Y = X ⬝ (c • Y)
  ∧ (c • X) ⬝ Y = c * (X ⬝ Y) := by
